posts.post_content: Works great with zombies with cycling. Like Gempalm polluter or Twisted Abomination. When he comes out he is already boosted from the cycled zombies
posts.html:
Works great with zombies with cycling. Like Gempalm polluter or Twisted Abomination. When he comes out he is already boosted from the cycled zombies
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Razorfist (7/15/2009 5:33:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great zombie, though, personally, I'd rather have quantity over quality, and although [Gempalm Polluter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gempalm Polluter) and [Twisted Abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twisted Abomination) pump him pretty well, I usually feel this guy is only a threat when you've got unblockable zombies with [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) and [Zombie Master](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombie Master) in play, and that's usually when ~ is going to eat your opponent's [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate) or X removal. Otherwise, ~ is just one huge body that beats chump blockers until your opponent pulls an answer to him.  
  
The 4cc mana cost for the ability I think is probably a little high, given that most of the other avatars had an ability which worked out better than counting the grave towards \*/\* (ie, lifelink, flying, haste, etc).  
  
Nonetheless, I still think this is a staple of pretty much any zombie deck.

The 4cc mana cost for the ability I think is probably a little high, given that most of the other avatars had an ability which worked out better than counting the grave towards */* (ie, lifelink, flying, haste, etc).
